content:
That sounds like a blast! It's great that you got to be involved in some hands-on activities with the kids at the Children's Museum. I'm sure they loved the LEGO building station and the mini-grocery store - those kinds of interactive experiences can be so engaging and educational for kids. It's fantastic that you were able to help facilitate those activities and make a positive impact on their museum visit.

And I completely agree with you about the photography exhibit - seeing the different styles and techniques on display can be really inspiring and thought-provoking. Photography is such a versatile medium, and there are so many talented artists out there pushing the boundaries of what's possible. I'm sure you'll have a great time exploring the exhibit and discovering new favorite artists or styles.

Are you planning on visiting the Modern Art Museum with anyone, or is this a solo outing?
